text: {p}We have calm weather in the forecast on Wednesday ahead of our next weathermaker which may bring some flurries to the valley overnight.{/p}{p}TODAY: Expect mostly sunny skies in Las Vegas with high temperatures reaching around 53 degrees. Winds will be fairly light out of the south up to 10 mph.{/p}{p}Air quality is ranked 'good' to 'moderate' for areas of haze in the central and east valley. Pollen levels are low.{/p}{p}TONIGHT: This evening our weather pattern starts to change as our next storm system rolls in. There's a chance of a rain and snow flurry mixture in the valley with up to around 2\" of snow possible on Mt. Charleston. The best timing is between 1:00 am and 5:00 am Thursday with gusty winds picking up after. Thursday morning is considered a WEATHER ALERT morning due to the chance of flurries in town plus gusty winds & cooler temperatures for the rest of the day Thursday. Valley low temperatures will drop to around 36 degrees but it will feel like temps in the 20s when you factor in the winds. Winds will be out of the north 10-20 mph with wind gusts around 30 mph.{/p}{p}Snow totals in the mountains will range from up to 2\" in the Spring Mountains, around 3\"-6\" in the Southern Sierra & across Northern Nevada with around 12\"-14\" near the Lake Tahoe area.{/p}{p}Fierce winds are in the forecast for portions of Inyo and San Bernardino County with gusts up to 40-50 mph possible. Winds will start backing down Thursday night followed by calmer weather on Friday.{/p}{p}Another storm will move into Nevada this weekend but will mostly impact the northern portion of the state. Calmer weather is in the forecast across Southern Nevada with valley high temperatures flirting with the 60s by Sunday.{/p}{p}On Martin Luther King Jr Day we'll see mostly sunny skies with high temperatures climbing to the mid 50s.{/p}{p}Beyond the 7-day, highs appear to rebound back to the low 60s by NEXT Wednesday through Friday.{/p}{p}Check back for more updates & have a great
